result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. Rakestraw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with M.O. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
Defendant is to comply with Sex Offender Registry's rules/regulations.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber priveleges and credit for 65 days served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael P. Rakestraw

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Kerra Stumbris, and Defendant, Michael P. Rakestraw, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Agreement reached.
